## Description {#details}

An alias analysis result set for globals.

This focuses on handling aliasing properties of globals and interprocedural function call mod/ref information.

Definition at line 30 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/globalsmodref-h">GlobalsModRef.h</a>.

## Private Member Functions

### AnalyzeCallGraph() {#a93350c3ad9876afa0595c7435b1bc04b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void GlobalsAAResult::AnalyzeCallGraph (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callgraph">CallGraph</a> &amp; CG, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp; M)</>}>
AnalyzeCallGraph - At this point, we know the functions where globals are immediately stored to and read from.

Propagate this information up the call graph to all callers and compute the mod/ref info for all memory for each function.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/globalsmodref-h/#l00113">113</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/globalsmodref-h">GlobalsModRef.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/globalsmodref-cpp/#l00495">495</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/globalsmodref-cpp">GlobalsModRef.cpp</a>.

### AnalyzeGlobals() {#a972ba2b1d032d748202d6838bc43658c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void GlobalsAAResult::AnalyzeGlobals (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp; M)</>}>
AnalyzeGlobals - Scan through the users of all of the internal <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">GlobalValue</a>&#39;s in the program.

If none of them have their &quot;address taken&quot; (really, their address passed to something nontrivial), record this fact, and record the functions that they are used directly in.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/globalsmodref-h/#l00112">112</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/globalsmodref-h">GlobalsModRef.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/globalsmodref-cpp/#l00261">261</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/globalsmodref-cpp">GlobalsModRef.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### AnalyzeIndirectGlobalMemory() {#aeed563c12316448cb86d56afff7746bd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool GlobalsAAResult::AnalyzeIndirectGlobalMemory (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvariable">GlobalVariable</a> &#42; GV)</>}>
AnalyzeIndirectGlobalMemory - We found an non-address-taken global variable which holds a pointer type.

See if the global always points to non-aliased heap memory: that is, all initializers of the globals store a value known to be obtained via a noalias return function call which have no other use. Further, all loads out of GV must directly use the memory, not store the pointer somewhere. If this is true, we consider the memory pointed to by GV to be owned by GV and can disambiguate other pointers from it.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/globalsmodref-h/#l00118">118</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/globalsmodref-h">GlobalsModRef.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/globalsmodref-cpp/#l00413">413</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/globalsmodref-cpp">GlobalsModRef.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### AnalyzeUsesOfPointer() {#ad1b974c3efa47a98859319a3a85e4475}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool GlobalsAAResult::AnalyzeUsesOfPointer (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl">SmallPtrSetImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42; &gt; &#42; Readers=nullptr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl">SmallPtrSetImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42; &gt; &#42; Writers=nullptr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">GlobalValue</a> &#42; OkayStoreDest=nullptr)</>}>
AnalyzeUsesOfPointer - Look at all of the users of the specified pointer.

If this is used by anything complex (i.e., the address escapes), return true. Also, while we are at it, keep track of those functions that read and write to the value.

If OkayStoreDest is non-null, stores into this global are allowed.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/globalsmodref-h/#l00114">114</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/globalsmodref-h">GlobalsModRef.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/globalsmodref-cpp/#l00320">320</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/globalsmodref-cpp">GlobalsModRef.cpp</a>.

### FunctionToSCCMap {#aff7a3cb8e90e060d415ef03e51ebc276}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DenseMap&lt;const Function &#42;, unsigned&gt; llvm::GlobalsAAResult::FunctionToSCCMap</>}>
A map of functions to SCC.

The SCCs are described by a simple integer <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> that is only useful for comparing for equality (are two functions in the same SCC or not?)

List of callbacks for globals being tracked by this analysis.

Note that these objects are quite large, but we only anticipate having one per global tracked by this analysis. There are numerous optimizations we could perform to the memory utilization here if this becomes a problem.
